intro: Cleistocalyx perspicuinervius, commonly known as the white-flowered hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant has large, heart-shaped leaves with a prominent midrib and fine veins, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. The flowers are typically borne in clusters and are known for their fragrant scent.
